result.execSummary:
The defendant MICHAEL C PLOSS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked, Defendant entitled to 7 days credit
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes: No possession or consumption of intoxicants.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.

Take all medications prescribed by treating physician. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Contact Court Security at 920-236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  The appointment location is:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 10:45 AM Defendant MICHAEL C PLOSS in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Tucker T. Tellefson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
From Atty. Patzer requesting a new plea and sentencing date

10:43 AM Defendant MICHAEL C PLOSS in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No violent contact with V1 in Oshkosh PD report #21-43835.  Absolute sobriety.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

09:06 AM Defendant MICHAEL C PLOSS in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests bond modification. Court grants bond modification.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
